reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated our 30th anniversary at the Royal Pavilion during May of 2011. We had made some specific requests relating to our celebration that were missed by select members of the staff. That first evening I left a message for the General Manager Wayne Kafcsak about my disappointment with what had not been arranged to my satisfaction. At breakfast the next morning we were asked if we would be willing to speak with Wayne after breakfast. We then met poolside and discussed the matter at length. Wayne was entirely professional and caring about how this very important trip had started out at less than the expected Fairmont level.
reviews.title: Our 30th anniversary at the RPV

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the very pleasant Fairmont Royal Pavilion in early December for a quiet break in five star luxury. Adults only so no noisy kids around the pool. The swimming pool is right next to the open bar which fronts the beach. It is peaceful and pleasant. BUT the hotel decided that it would be a good idea to wheel a huge television into the bar during Saturday afternoon and turn on the football and sport. This played out across the swimming pool area and the whole of the bar for the entire afternoon on Saturday and Sunday. Asking the manager about it, he said that it was due to "popular demand". Two men were watching it. I asked why these men could not watch it in their rooms. He said it was more pleasant for them to watch in the bar but he would turn the volume down slightly. It was not pleasant for me or other guests who had paid for a quiet holiday and it turned the bar area from a romantic retreat into a sports bar...(which the staff seemed to appreciate as they could watch the sport while no guests came in for a drink.) What is the hotel trying to achieve here? Romance and football don't mix....provide a separate venue for your sports fans away from loved up couples and wealthy middle aged-women who want a bit of peace like me!! If you don't, we will go elsewhere.
reviews.title: LUXURY HOTEL FEATURES FOOTBALL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Pavilion about 12 times and always enjoyed it! Mainly due to fabulous beach and friendly staff .We have just returned today having spent 8 days there. Management has changed and they have now adopted a complete smoking ban in the hotel. the only place one can smoke is on the beach or in the car park! I realize that smokers are very much in the minority these days-but when one spends an awful lot of money to stay in a nice hotel its quite ridiculous to be told that you have to have your pre dinner drink ,or your coffee at the end of the meal, in the car park or on the beach! Especially when the hotel boasts such a large outdoor area which would not interfere with other diners.We visited several other venues for meals and they all catered for peoples different habits! I intend to stay at Sandy Lane next time or the Sandpiper. The hotel should include their strict policy on their website- but they dont!
reviews.title: Smokers beware!!
